definition: can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: I’ll never forget a class meeting I shared with my students some 6 years ago.
sentences.chinese: 我永不會忘記6年前的那次學生班會。

sentences.english: You should your teacher the class meeting.
sentences.chinese: 你應當和你的老師討論一下班會的事。

sentences.english: That was an unusual class meeting.
Miss Wang is holding a class meeting on how to learn English.
sentences.chinese: 王老師正在召開一次關於如何學習英語的班會。

sentences.english: As a clear voice and ushered in the second quarter of class meetings.
sentences.chinese: 隨着一陣清脆的聲音，迎來了第二節班會課。

sentences.english: We have a class meeting every Monday.
School early, classes will run for the form class using small cadres have classes.
sentences.chinese: 開學初，班會課採用競選的形式產生班中小幹部。

sentences.english: And this one quarter, they invited a class meetings jet li uncle.
sentences.chinese: 而這一節班會課，他們請來了李連杰叔叔。

sentences.english: She said that her class will hold a class meeting next Monday.
sentences.chinese: 她說她們班下週一將要上一節班會課。

sentences.english: The class meeting will take place on Monday.
sentences.chinese: 班會將會在星期一舉行。

sentences.english: The monitor is thinking about calling a class meeting.
sentences.chinese: 班長正在考慮開一次班會。

sentences.english: The students had a class meeting last Friday.
sentences.chinese: 上週五學生們開了一次班會。

sentences.english: They held a class meeting last week.
Last Friday afternoon, we had our last class meeting in our classroom.
sentences.chinese: 上週五下午，我們在教室裏舉行了最後一次班會。

sentences.english: She suggested/ advised/ proposed that the class meeting (should) not be held on Saturday.
sentences.chinese: 她建議班會不要在星期六舉行。

sentences.english: His having been praised at the class meeting made us all encouraged.
sentences.chinese: 他在班會課上受到表揚，鼓舞了我們大家。
